text.0: the maruts of resistless might who love the rain resplendent terrible like wild beasts in their strength.
text.1: glowing like flames of fire impetuous in career blowing the wandering raincloud have disclosed the kine.
text.2: they gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars like cloudborn lightnings shine the torrents of their rain.
text.3: since the strong rudra o maruts with brilliant chests sprang into life for you in pṛśnis radiant lap.
text.4: they drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds with the streams rapid cars they hasten on their way.
text.5: maruts with helms of gold ye who make all things shake come with your spotted deer oneminded to our food.
text.6: they have bestowed of mitra all that live to feed they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow.
text.7: whose steeds are spotted deer whose riches never fail like horses in full speed bound to the pole in work.
text.8: with brightlyflaming kine whose udders swell with milk with glittering lances on your unobstructed paths.
text.9: o maruts of one mind like swans who seek their nests come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.
text.10: to these our prayers o maruts come unanimous come ye to our libations like the praise of men.
text.11: make it swell like a mare in udder like a cow and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength.
text.12: give us a steed o maruts mighty in the car prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day.
text.13: food to your praisers to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom power uninjured unsurpassed.
text.14: when the brightchested maruts lavish of their gifts bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars.
text.15: then as the milchcow feeds her calf within the stalls they pour forth food for all oblationbringing men.
text.16: save us o maruts vasus from the injurer the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves.
text.17: with chariot all aflame compass him round about o rudras cast away the foemans deadly bolt.
text.18: wellknown ye maruts is that wondrous course of yours when they milked pṛśnis udder close akin to her.
text.19: or when to shame the bard who lauded rudras sons ye o infallible brought trita to decay.
text.20: we call you such great maruts following wonted ways to the oblation paid to viṣṇu speederon.
text.21: with ladles lifted up with prayer we seek of them preeminent goldenhued the wealth which all extol.
text.22: they the daśagvas first of all brought sacrifice they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us.
text.23: dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk.
text.24: the rudras have rejoiced them in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments.
text.25: they with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue.
text.26: soliciting their high protection for our help with this our adoration we sing praise to them.
text.27: whom for assistance like the five terrestrial priests trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car.
text.28: so may your favouring help be turned to usward your kindness like a lowing cow approach us.
text.29: wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning.
